t: A Plea for Relief from Persecutors
A Contemplation of David. A Prayer when he was in the cave.
I*pn cry out to the Lord*s with my voice; With*ld my voice to the Lord*s I make my supplication.
I*ld pour out my complaint before Him; I*ld declare before Him my trouble.
When*ln my spirit was overwhelmed within me, Then*ld You knew my path. In*ld the way in which I walk They*ld have secretly set a snare for me.
Look*ld on my*i right hand and see, For*ld there*i is*i no one who acknowledges me; Refuge*ld has failed me; No*ld one cares for my soul.
I*ln cried out to You, O Lord:*s I*ld said, “You are*i my refuge, My*ld portion in the land of the living.
Attend*ld to my cry, For*ld I am brought very low; Deliver*ld me from my persecutors, For*ld they are stronger than I.
Bring*ld my soul out of prison, That*ld I may praise Your name; The*ld righteous shall surround me, For*ld You shall deal bountifully with me.”
